Description: This educational session will address novel antibody drug conjugate (ADC) designs in development, focusing on how such agents can be used to deliver non-chemotherapy payloads. The first talk will provide a brief overview of ADCs, followed by an introduction of antibody-linked radioimmunoconjugates and their potential for the treatment of solid tumors.  The second talk will discuss BCL-XL inhibitors as warheads for ADCs, including the development of ABBV-155, a BCL-XL inhibitor linked to an anti-B7H3 targeting antibody.  The final speaker will address the challenges and opportunities with selecting patients for ADC therapeutics, including how such approaches may differ when ADCs with non-chemotherapy payloads are administered.
Location: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
SearchResultFooter: La Nouvelle Orleans A-B, Convention Center
Title: Novel Antibody Drug Conjugates
